---
title: "This is value for parameter 1: `r params$pv1` and  parameter 2: `r params$pv2`."
author: "John Curtin"
params:
  pv1: 5
  pv2: 10
---

You can use these parameters directly in your scripts
```{r}
params$pv1 + params$pv2
```

However, I find that its cumbersome to have to use param$ before each variable name.  I prefer to assign the parameters to variables by the same name at the top of the script
```{r}
pv1 <- params$pv1
pv2 <- params$pv2
```

You can then use these variables as normal

```{r}
pv1 + pv2
```
